Description: Shoulder sherd of large Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; white slip; exterior: band of black tongues with narrow brown line below; painted decoration consisting of frieze of partridges to right (from left, trace of beak of partridge, most of central partridge with beak and throat in brown outline and brown lines on reserved under-body; tail feathers of right-hand bird).
Curator's comments: For similar partridges, see British Museum 1861,0425.47. The sherd falls within Cook's Group F of "other amphorae with animals or birds on shoulder".
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 8, no. 7, pl. 8, no. 7)
Cook 1933-1934 / Fikellura Pottery (p. 12, no. 3, pp. 64-5) (Incorrectly labelled 86.4-1.274)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 245, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.039)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 138-9, Nau 105, pl. 23c)
